meanings.sent1: She outstarted all her classmates in the race.
meanings.sent2: The sprinter outstarted his competitors at the starting line.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise outstarted the hare in the race, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm outstarted the rest of the team, setting a high bar for motivation.
meanings.sent5: The early bird outstarted the other birds, catching the juiciest worm.

meanings.sent1: He outstarted the meeting by arriving early.
meanings.sent2: The eager student outstarted the lesson by raising her hand first.
meanings.sent3: The chef outstarted the dinner rush by preparing ingredients in advance.
meanings.sent4: The sun outstarted the moon in the sky, shining brightly before nightfall.
meanings.sent5: The diligent worker outstarted his colleagues by completing tasks ahead of schedule.

meanings.definition: To initiate or commence before others.
meanings.sent1: The team captain outstarted the game with a motivational speech.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra conductor outstarted the concert by raising his baton.
meanings.sent3: The child outstarted the bedtime routine by asking for an extra story.
meanings.sent4: The leader outstarted the project, setting the pace for the rest of the team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher outstarted the class discussion by posing a thought-provoking question.
